bits","x":490,"y":265,"ins":[],"inNames":[],"outNames":[],"params":{"text":"Bits for the initial 8 bit memory are randomly generated using the hold-noise technique. 

Important : the hold is triggered when the pulse signal crosses 0 while it is rising : the rising edge. 
    __
   |  |
...|..|
|  |
|__|
 1/2

That means that this event happens a 1/2 period of this pulse after "play" was pressed. This delay has to be taken in consideration when the memory is loaded with (delayed) bits during the SeedTime [s],"}},"557":{"type":"Notes","name":"TUnits->Freq","x":29,"y":724,"ins":[],"inNames":[],"outNames":[],"params":{"text":"The frequency [Hz] of the pulse is equal to the 1/Time Unit [s], itself equal to the SeedTime [s] / number of bits"}},"558":{"type":"Notes","name":"InitialDelay","x":932,"y":722,"ins":[],"inNames":[],"outNames":[],"params":{"text":"Important : As the random bits feeding the memory during the seed Time have a 1/2 period of the pulse delay (see random bits), the same initial delay has to be applied to the inverted pulse signal defining the length of the Seed.

1....... ______........__ 
        |      |      |
0...|Del| Seed |______| aso.

This delay is equal to 
0.5 [1/2 period] * TimeUnit [s]"}},"560":{"type":"Notes","name":"1ShotIni&Per","x":1329,"y":720,"ins":[],"inNames":[],"outNames":[],"params":{"text":"The random bits in the memory should only be used one time, then the programmed head of the Turing machine should modify the memory by itself. To do so the further repetition of the Seed Pulse are canceled by a period-time delayed version of it.

1  ______ ...... _____ ....
  |      |      |     |
0.| Seed |______|.....|____

minus

1 .............. _____ ....
  PeriodDelay   |     |
0_______________|.....|____

equals

1  ______ 
  |      | 
0.|      |_________________

This "initial On/Off gate" is used to generate :

a) the initial memory state (as explained)
b) the initial Head Position (1 to 8)
c) the inital State (1 to 2)

The Seed delayed by a period time [PerDelaySeed] is used to build a trigger (rising edge of a pulse) that will catch [hold] the New (hold) Head Position and new (hold) State according to the program of the Turing machine."}},"561":{"type":"Scope","name":"Seed On/off","x":1127,"y":1064,"ins":[["328",0]],"inNames":[""],"outNames":[],"params":{"minVal":-0.1,"maxVal":1.1}},"562":{"type":"Scope","name":"On/Off","x":1687,"y":1032,"ins":[["563",0]],"inNames":[""],"outNames":[],"params":{"minVal":-0.1,"maxVal":1.1}},"563":{"type":"Nop","name":"On/Off","x":1689,"y":980,"ins":[["429",0]],"inNames":[""],"outNames":[""],"params":{}},"564":{"type":"Nop","name":"Random Bits","x":980,"y":669,"ins":[["6",0]],"inNames":[""],"outNames":[""],"params":{}},"565":{"type":"Nop","name":"PerDSeedTrig","x":2202,"y":1211,"ins":[["546",0]],"inNames":[""],"outNames":[""],"params":{}},"566":{"type":"Notes","name":"FeedBackZone","x":2015,"y":759,"ins":[],"inNames":[],"outNames":[],"params":{"text":"In this vertical Zone :

The initial Head position [5] and The initial State [1] are defined

&

a) The Modified Memory (the tape) is fed back into the loop.

b) The modified (Hold) Head Position is fed back into the loop using the Periodic (delayed Seed) Trigger.

b) The modified (Hold) State is fed back into the loop using the Periodic (delayed Seed) Trigger.

See the end of the process (on the right of the craft) where and how those new head end state values are stored."}},"567":{"type":"Notes","name":"The PCounter","x":1464,"y":108,"ins":[],"inNames":[],"outNames":[],"params":{"text":"as there are 8 bits in the memory, a counter needs to follow there position during time.

Important: as there is an initial delay in the whole process due to the first random fill of the memory (see random Bits), the counter itself has to begin it's count with a perfect delay with the right number. As the counter modulo method [BaseCnt 0-8] begins with a zero during 1 time unit and the random memory filling process begins with a 0.5 period delay. The counter (to start at 1 when the seed trigger arrives) has to be delay by a 1.5 factor and 1 must be added to the result of the count."}},"568":{"type":"Scope","name":"BaseCnt 0-8","x":1905,"y":514,"ins":[["333",0]],"inNames":[""],"outNames":[],"params":{"minVal":-0.1,"maxVal":8.1}},"569":{"type":"Scope","name":"Seed On/Off","x":1901,"y":178,"ins":[["328",0]],"inNames":[""],"outNames":[],"params":{"minVal":-0.1,"maxVal":1.1}},"570":{"type":"Notes","name":"Count=HedPos","x":2155,"y":402,"ins":[],"inNames":[],"outNames":[],"params":{"text":"When the counter, counting the memory positions is equal to the actual Head Positon it's the signal that the changes operated by the program at this position must be stored (hold) until the next Seed begins. That's a hold trigger using the rising edge of a pulse signal.

At the same time, the bit in the memory must be changed (or not) according to the program. So a delete and writing process must be handled. Mem on/off and the inverted NewMem on/off are used"}},"571":{"type":"Notes","name":"Modified MEM","x":3578,"y":460,"ins":[],"inNames":[],"outNames":[],"params":{"text":"Here the Memory is modified when the head position is equal to the memory position counter. The New Memory Value computed by the program is substituted to the ancient one contained in MEM. The whole memory is then delay during a Period to be fed back in the computing process."}},"572":{"type":"Nop","name":"> MEM","x":3443,"y":676,"ins":[["287",0]],"inNames":[""],"outNames":[""],"params":{}},"573":{"type":"Notes","name":"The PROGRAM","x":3273,"y":901,"ins":[],"inNames":[],"outNames":[],"params":{"text":"The rules of the 2 state Program are implemented below :

State | MVal | NMVal | Dir | NState
1       0      1       1     1       
1       1      0      -1     2
2       0      1      -1     1
2       1      0       1     1

For example of the fits line of the progrram: if the head is in the state 1 and reads the value 0 in the memory, it has to wite the value New Momory value 1 go to the right (1) and put itself in the state 1.


The program as implemented below benefits the fact that if the state = 0 (after the seed time until the end of the period the outputs (NewMemVal ; NewSate ; Direction) is (0;0;0)."}},"574":{"type":"Notes","name":"Hello World","x":25,"y":25,"ins":[],"inNames":[],"outNames":[],"params":{"text":"2 state & 8 bit Turing Machine
------------------------------

Here I do realize an old dream in noisecraft : to craft a simple Turing Machine! It cost me a lot of energy until the solution appeared.

A Turing machine is a computer conceptualized by Alan Turing (1912-1954) : an infinite memory tape on which at least two symbols can be read and written by a moving head following a program of the form : 

If the head is in the State 1 and reads the symbol 1, then it has to replace it by the symbol 0, go to the right and put itself in the state 2. All calculable functions can be calculated by this elementary computing process and every program in the world can be reduced to a Turing machine.

In my implementation, the tape is only 8 bits long (8 places with zeros or ones) and the program is defined only for 2 states (1 and 2). If the Head is at the end of the tape on the right (position 8) and has to move to the right, then it shifts to left of the tape (position 1). The same thing happens from the extreme left of the tape to the extreme right.

My implementation first fills the 8 bit memory with random bits (0 or 1), then applies the program.

I had to handle with unwanted but necessary delays due to the fact that the Hold (memory) node triggers on the rising edge of a pulse (when it crosses 0 from -1 to +1). this happens after a 1/2 period delay (see Random bits Note).

I wrote a lot of Notes to explain the different parts of the craft. I hope it will help.

What to do with it ?

The Memory (MEM) could be used to code frequencies, or other modulation values, or trigger some event. The same can be done with (NewMemVal>)

NewState, Direction and NewHeadPosition, can also be used for some kind of modulation.

So Enjoy, 

(a or not b)
https://aornotb.bandcamp.com/

Those values are fed back to be used int he next Seed period."}},"579":{"type":"Scope","name":"The tape:MEM","x":412,"y":25,"ins":[["287",0]],"inNames":[""],"outNames":[],"params":{"minVal":-0.1,"maxVal":1.1}}}}
